--- title: "Working with a single dataset" order: 4 title-slide-attributes: data-background-gradient: linear-gradient(to top right, {{< brand color background >}}, {{< brand color pastelpink >}}, {{< brand color fmorange >}}, {{< brand color tangerine >}}) format: revealjs: margin: .15 quarto-required: ">= 1.6.0" width: 1600 height: 900 slide-number: "c" css: ../styles.css code-copy: true echo: true code-overflow: scroll --- ::: {.cell} ::: # Data: Penguins ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 8 species island bill_len bill_dep flipper_len body_mass sex year 1 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 39.1 18.7 181 3750 male 2007 2 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 39.5 17.4 186 3800 femaâ€¦ 2007 3 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 40.3 18 195 3250 femaâ€¦ 2007 4 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ NA NA NA NA 2007 5 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 36.7 19.3 193 3450 femaâ€¦ 2007 6 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 39.3 20.6 190 3650 male 2007 7 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 38.9 17.8 181 3625 femaâ€¦ 2007 8 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 39.2 19.6 195 4675 male 2007 9 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 34.1 18.1 193 3475 2007 10 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 42 20.2 190 4250 2007 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: # `select` and `arrange` {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FFFFFF, #7CDCFF, #7CDCFF, #7CDCFF)"} ## `select` - keep variables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% select(species, island) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 2 species island 1 Adelie Torgersen 2 Adelie Torgersen 3 Adelie Torgersen 4 Adelie Torgersen 5 Adelie Torgersen 6 Adelie Torgersen 7 Adelie Torgersen 8 Adelie Torgersen 9 Adelie Torgersen 10 Adelie Torgersen # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## `select` - exclude variables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% select(-year) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 7 species island bill_len bill_dep flipper_len body_mass sex 1 Adelie Torgersen 39.1 18.7 181 3750 male 2 Adelie Torgersen 39.5 17.4 186 3800 female 3 Adelie Torgersen 40.3 18 195 3250 female 4 Adelie Torgersen NA NA NA NA 5 Adelie Torgersen 36.7 19.3 193 3450 female 6 Adelie Torgersen 39.3 20.6 190 3650 male 7 Adelie Torgersen 38.9 17.8 181 3625 female 8 Adelie Torgersen 39.2 19.6 195 4675 male 9 Adelie Torgersen 34.1 18.1 193 3475 10 Adelie Torgersen 42 20.2 190 4250 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## `select` - multiple variables - a range of variables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% select(species:bill_dep) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 4 species island bill_len bill_dep 1 Adelie Torgersen 39.1 18.7 2 Adelie Torgersen 39.5 17.4 3 Adelie Torgersen 40.3 18 4 Adelie Torgersen NA NA 5 Adelie Torgersen 36.7 19.3 6 Adelie Torgersen 39.3 20.6 7 Adelie Torgersen 38.9 17.8 8 Adelie Torgersen 39.2 19.6 9 Adelie Torgersen 34.1 18.1 10 Adelie Torgersen 42 20.2 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## `select` - multiple variables - a range of variables - variables with certain characteristics . . . ::: column ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% select(starts_with("bill")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 2 bill_len bill_dep 1 39.1 18.7 2 39.5 17.4 3 40.3 18 4 NA NA 5 36.7 19.3 6 39.3 20.6 7 38.9 17.8 8 39.2 19.6 9 34.1 18.1 10 42 20.2 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: column ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% select(ends_with("len")) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 2 bill_len flipper_len 1 39.1 181 2 39.5 186 3 40.3 195 4 NA NA 5 36.7 193 6 39.3 190 7 38.9 181 8 39.2 195 9 34.1 193 10 42 190 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## Select helpers - `starts_with()`: Starts with a prefix - `ends_with()`: Ends with a suffix - `contains()`: Contains a literal string - `num_range()`: Matches a numerical range like x01, x02, x03 - `one_of()`: Matches variable names in a character vector - `everything()`: Matches all variables - `last_col()`: Select last variable, possibly with an offset - `matches()`: Matches a regular expression (a sequence of symbols/characters expressing a string/pattern to be searched for within text) ::: footnote See help for any of these functions for more info, e.g. `?everything`. ::: ## `arrange` in ascending / descending order ::: {.cell} ::: ::: column ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% select(species,bill_dep) %>% arrange(bill_dep) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 2 species bill_dep 1 Gentoo 13.1 2 Gentoo 13.2 3 Gentoo 13.3 4 Gentoo 13.4 5 Gentoo 13.5 6 Gentoo 13.5 7 Gentoo 13.6 8 Gentoo 13.7 9 Gentoo 13.7 10 Gentoo 13.7 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: column ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% select(species,bill_dep) %>% arrange(desc(bill_dep)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 2 species bill_dep 1 Adelie 21.5 2 Adelie 21.2 3 Adelie 21.2 4 Adelie 21.1 5 Adelie 21.1 6 Adelie 21.1 7 Chinstrap 20.8 8 Adelie 20.7 9 Adelie 20.7 10 Chinstrap 20.7 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: . . . ::: column ::: ::: column ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% select(species,bill_dep) %>% arrange(-bill_dep) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 2 species bill_dep 1 Adelie 21.5 2 Adelie 21.2 3 Adelie 21.2 4 Adelie 21.1 5 Adelie 21.1 6 Adelie 21.1 7 Chinstrap 20.8 8 Adelie 20.7 9 Adelie 20.7 10 Chinstrap 20.7 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: # `filter` {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FFFFFF, #FECCDD, #FECCDD, #FECCDD)"} ::: {.cell} ::: ## `filter` to select a subset of rows ::: {.cell labels='filter'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% filter(species == "Adelie") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 152 Ã— 8 species island bill_len bill_dep flipper_len body_mass sex year 1 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 39.1 18.7 181 3750 male 2007 2 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 39.5 17.4 186 3800 femaâ€¦ 2007 3 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 40.3 18 195 3250 femaâ€¦ 2007 4 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ NA NA NA NA 2007 5 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 36.7 19.3 193 3450 femaâ€¦ 2007 6 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 39.3 20.6 190 3650 male 2007 7 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 38.9 17.8 181 3625 femaâ€¦ 2007 8 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 39.2 19.6 195 4675 male 2007 9 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 34.1 18.1 193 3475 2007 10 Adelie Torgeâ€¦ 42 20.2 190 4250 2007 # â„¹ 142 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## `filter` for many conditions at once ::: {.cell labels='filter-multi'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3,4"} penguins %>% filter( species == "Adelie", bill_dep > 20 ) %>% select(species:bill_dep) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 14 Ã— 4 species island bill_len bill_dep 1 Adelie Torgersen 39.3 20.6 2 Adelie Torgersen 42 20.2 3 Adelie Torgersen 38.6 21.2 4 Adelie Torgersen 34.6 21.1 5 Adelie Torgersen 42.5 20.7 6 Adelie Torgersen 46 21.5 7 Adelie Dream 39.2 21.1 8 Adelie Dream 42.3 21.2 9 Adelie Biscoe 41.3 21.1 10 Adelie Dream 41.3 20.3 11 Adelie Biscoe 45.6 20.3 12 Adelie Biscoe 39.6 20.7 13 Adelie Torgersen 37.3 20.5 14 Adelie Dream 40.2 20.1 ``` ::: ::: ## `filter` for more complex conditions ::: {.cell labels='filter-complex'} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="4"} penguins %>% filter( species == "Adelie", bill_dep > 20 | bill_dep < 17 ) %>% select(species:bill_dep) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 29 Ã— 4 species island bill_len bill_dep 1 Adelie Torgersen 39.3 20.6 2 Adelie Torgersen 42 20.2 3 Adelie Torgersen 38.6 21.2 4 Adelie Torgersen 34.6 21.1 5 Adelie Torgersen 42.5 20.7 6 Adelie Torgersen 46 21.5 7 Adelie Dream 39.5 16.7 8 Adelie Dream 39.2 21.1 9 Adelie Dream 37 16.9 10 Adelie Dream 42.3 21.2 # â„¹ 19 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## Logical operators in R
| operator | definition | | operator | definition | |----------|------------------------|----|------------|------------------------| | `<` | less than | | `x & y` | `x` AND `y` | | `<=` | less than or equal to | | `x | y` | `x` OR `y` | | `>` | greater than | | `is.na(x)` | test if `x` is `NA` | | `>=` | greater than or equal to | | `!is.na(x)` | test if `x` is not `NA` | | `==` | exactly equal to | | `x %in% y` | test if `x` is in `y` | | `!=` | not equal to | | `!(x %in% y)` | test if `x` is not in `y` | # `distinct` and `count` {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FFFFFF, #7CDCFF, #7CDCFF, #7CDCFF)"} ## `distinct` to filter for unique rows ... and `arrange` to order alphabetically ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% distinct(species) %>% arrange(species) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 1 species 1 Adelie 2 Chinstrap 3 Gentoo ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: {.column} ::: fragment ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% distinct(species, island) %>% arrange(species, island) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 Ã— 2 species island 1 Adelie Biscoe 2 Adelie Dream 3 Adelie Torgersen 4 Chinstrap Dream 5 Gentoo Biscoe ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## `count` to create frequency tables ::: {.column} Alphabetical ordering by default
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% count(species) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species n 1 Adelie 152 2 Chinstrap 68 3 Gentoo 124 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: {.column} ::: fragment Order by descending frequency
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% count(species, sort = TRUE) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species n 1 Adelie 152 2 Gentoo 124 3 Chinstrap 68 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: ## `count` and `arrange` ::: {.column} Arrange by ascending frequency order ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% count(species) %>% arrange(n) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species n 1 Chinstrap 68 2 Gentoo 124 3 Adelie 152 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: {.column} ::: fragment Arrange by descending frequency order ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% count(species) %>% arrange(desc(n)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species n 1 Adelie 152 2 Gentoo 124 3 Chinstrap 68 ``` ::: ::: *same output as `sort = TRUE`* ::: :::: ## `count` for multiple variables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% count(species,island) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 Ã— 3 species island n 1 Adelie Biscoe 44 2 Adelie Dream 56 3 Adelie Torgersen 52 4 Chinstrap Dream 68 5 Gentoo Biscoe 124 ``` ::: ::: ## order matters when you `count` ::: {.column} `species` first ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% count(species,island) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 Ã— 3 species island n 1 Adelie Biscoe 44 2 Adelie Dream 56 3 Adelie Torgersen 52 4 Chinstrap Dream 68 5 Gentoo Biscoe 124 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: {.column} ::: fragment `island` first ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% count(island,species) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 Ã— 3 island species n 1 Biscoe Adelie 44 2 Biscoe Gentoo 124 3 Dream Adelie 56 4 Dream Chinstrap 68 5 Torgersen Adelie 52 ``` ::: ::: ::: :::: # Your turn:
`select`, `arrange`, `filter`, `distinct`, `count` {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom, #FFFFFF, #FFFFFF, #6BE1CA)"} âœ‹ if you have questions or need help ``{=html} when you are finished ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}
15:00
``` ::: ::: # `mutate` {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FFFFFF, #FECCDD, #FECCDD, #FECCDD)"} ## `mutate` to add a new variable ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep) %>% select(species:bill_dep,bill_ratio) %>% arrange(desc(bill_ratio)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 344 Ã— 5 species island bill_len bill_dep bill_ratio 1 Gentoo Biscoe 51.3 14.2 3.61 2 Gentoo Biscoe 50.2 14.3 3.51 3 Gentoo Biscoe 59.6 17 3.51 4 Gentoo Biscoe 46.1 13.2 3.49 5 Gentoo Biscoe 54.3 15.7 3.46 6 Gentoo Biscoe 48.7 14.1 3.45 7 Gentoo Biscoe 47.2 13.7 3.45 8 Gentoo Biscoe 46.5 13.5 3.44 9 Gentoo Biscoe 55.1 16 3.44 10 Gentoo Biscoe 48.5 14.1 3.44 # â„¹ 334 more rows ``` ::: ::: ## Small and large bill ratios ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="4"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep) %>% select(species,bill_ratio) %>% filter(bill_ratio < 2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 35 Ã— 2 species bill_ratio 1 Adelie 1.90 2 Adelie 1.91 3 Adelie 1.88 4 Adelie 1.82 5 Adelie 1.64 6 Adelie 1.87 7 Adelie 1.87 8 Adelie 1.87 9 Adelie 1.86 10 Adelie 1.94 # â„¹ 25 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="4"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep) %>% select(species,bill_ratio) %>% filter(bill_ratio > 3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 109 Ã— 2 species bill_ratio 1 Gentoo 3.49 2 Gentoo 3.07 3 Gentoo 3.45 4 Gentoo 3.29 5 Gentoo 3.28 6 Gentoo 3.44 7 Gentoo 3.11 8 Gentoo 3.05 9 Gentoo 3.23 10 Gentoo 3.04 # â„¹ 99 more rows ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `mutate` based on criteria ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = ifelse(bill_ratio < 2, "small", "large")) %>% count(species,ratio_class) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 Ã— 3 species ratio_class n 1 Adelie large 116 2 Adelie small 35 3 Adelie 1 4 Chinstrap large 68 5 Gentoo large 123 6 Gentoo 1 ``` ::: ::: ## `mutate` based on criteria (cont.) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3-5"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small", bill_ratio > 3 ~ "large", TRUE ~ "medium")) %>% count(species,ratio_class) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 Ã— 3 species ratio_class n 1 Adelie medium 117 2 Adelie small 35 3 Chinstrap large 1 4 Chinstrap medium 67 5 Gentoo large 108 6 Gentoo medium 16 ``` ::: ::: ## `case_when` overview - Multiple if/else statements in a single easy to read format - Assessed in order - If no `.default` or `TRUE` statement provided will result in missing data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3,4"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small", bill_ratio > 3 ~ "large")) %>% count(species,ratio_class) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 Ã— 3 species ratio_class n 1 Adelie small 35 2 Adelie 117 3 Chinstrap large 1 4 Chinstrap 67 5 Gentoo large 108 6 Gentoo 16 ``` ::: ::: ## `case_when` - final else statement ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="5"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small", bill_ratio > 3 ~ "large", TRUE ~ "medium")) %>% count(species,ratio_class) ``` :::
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(.default = "medium", bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small", bill_ratio > 3 ~ "large")) %>% count(species,ratio_class) ``` ::: ## `case_when` order matters ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3,4"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small", bill_ratio < 3 ~ "medium", TRUE ~ "large")) %>% count(species,ratio_class) ``` :::
::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3,4"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(bill_ratio < 3 ~ "medium", bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small", TRUE ~ "large")) %>% count(species,ratio_class) ``` ::: ::: {.notes} left side: - if `bill_ratio < 2` then small - else if `bill_ratio < 3` then medium - else then large right side: - if `bill_ration < 3` then medium - else if `bill_ratio < 2` then small - The `small` category will never be utilized since the medium will take all < 2 automatically ::: ## `case_when` order matters (cont.) ::: {.cell} ::: ::: column ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="1"} case_when(bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small", bill_ratio < 3 ~ "medium", TRUE ~ "large")) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 7 Ã— 3 species ratio_class n 1 Adelie large 1 2 Adelie medium 116 3 Adelie small 35 4 Chinstrap large 1 5 Chinstrap medium 67 6 Gentoo large 109 7 Gentoo medium 15 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: column ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="1"} case_when(bill_ratio < 3 ~ "medium", bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small", TRUE ~ "large")) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 6 Ã— 3 species ratio_class n 1 Adelie large 1 2 Adelie medium 151 3 Chinstrap large 1 4 Chinstrap medium 67 5 Gentoo large 109 6 Gentoo medium 15 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `case_when` order matters (cont.) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3-8"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(bill_ratio < 2 & sex == "female" ~ "small-female", bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small-male", bill_ratio < 3 & sex == "female" ~ "medium-female", bill_ratio < 3 ~ "medium-male", sex == "female" ~ "large-female", TRUE ~ "large-male")) %>% count(sex,ratio_class) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3-8"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small-male", bill_ratio < 2 & sex == "female" ~ "small-female", bill_ratio < 3 ~ "medium-male", bill_ratio < 3 & sex == "female" ~ "medium-female", sex == "female" ~ "large-female", TRUE ~ "large-male")) %>% count(sex,ratio_class) ``` ::: ## `case_when` order matters (cont.) ::: {.cell} ::: ::: column ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="1,2"} case_when(bill_ratio < 2 & sex == "female" ~ "small-female", bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small-male", bill_ratio < 3 & sex == "female" ~ "medium-female", bill_ratio < 3 ~ "medium-male", sex == "female" ~ "large-female", TRUE ~ "large-male") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 9 Ã— 3 sex ratio_class n 1 female large-female 55 2 female medium-female 93 3 female small-female 17 4 male large-male 51 5 male medium-male 101 6 male small-male 16 7 large-male 5 8 medium-male 4 9 small-male 2 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: column ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="1,2"} case_when(bill_ratio < 2 ~ "small-male", bill_ratio < 2 & sex == "female" ~ "small-female", bill_ratio < 3 ~ "medium-male", bill_ratio < 3 & sex == "female" ~ "medium-female", sex == "female" ~ "large-female", TRUE ~ "large-male") ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 9 Ã— 3 sex ratio_class n 1 female large-female 55 2 female medium-male 93 3 female small-male 17 4 male large-male 51 5 male medium-male 101 6 male small-male 16 7 large-male 5 8 medium-male 4 9 small-male 2 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## `case_when` missing data ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="4,6,8"} penguins %>% mutate(bill_ratio = bill_len / bill_dep, ratio_class = case_when(bill_ratio < 2 & sex == "female" ~ "small-female", bill_ratio < 2 & sex == "male" ~ "small-male", bill_ratio < 3 & sex == "female" ~ "medium-female", bill_ratio < 3 & sex == "male" ~ "medium-male", sex == "female" ~ "large-female", sex == "male" ~ "large-male")) %>% count(sex,ratio_class) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 7 Ã— 3 sex ratio_class n 1 female large-female 55 2 female medium-female 93 3 female small-female 17 4 male large-male 51 5 male medium-male 101 6 male small-male 16 7 11 ``` ::: ::: # `summarize` and `group_by` {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom right, #FFFFFF, #7CDCFF, #7CDCFF, #7CDCFF)"} ## `summarize` for summary stats ::: {.incremental} - Fun fact: `summarize` and `summarise` both work - Hadley Wickham, creator of the `tidyverse` is from New Zealand - `mutate`: observation level - `summarize`: aggregation of data ::: . . . ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% summarize(avg_bill_len = mean(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 Ã— 1 avg_bill_len 1 43.9 ``` ::: ::: # {background-gradient="radial-gradient(#FFA219, #FFFFFF, #FFFFFF)"} ::: {.tip} ðŸ’¡Tip!

`summarize()` changes the data frame entirely. It collapses rows down to a single summary statistic, and removes all columns that are irrelevant to the calculation. ::: ## `group_by` for grouped operations ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarize(avg_bill_len = mean(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species avg_bill_len 1 Adelie 38.8 2 Chinstrap 48.8 3 Gentoo 47.5 ``` ::: ::: ## `group_by` - multiple variables ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% group_by(species,island) %>% summarize(avg_bill_len = mean(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 Ã— 3 # Groups: species [3] species island avg_bill_len 1 Adelie Biscoe 39.0 2 Adelie Dream 38.5 3 Adelie Torgersen 39.0 4 Chinstrap Dream 48.8 5 Gentoo Biscoe 47.5 ``` ::: ::: ## Calculating frequencies - `count` is simply short for `group_by` then determine frequencies - the following two results give the same result . . . ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarize(n = n()) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species n 1 Adelie 152 2 Chinstrap 68 3 Gentoo 124 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.column} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} penguins %>% count(species) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species n 1 Adelie 152 2 Chinstrap 68 3 Gentoo 124 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Multiple summary statistics `summarize` can be used for multiple summary statistics as well ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} penguins %>% summarize( min_bill_len = min(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE), mean_bill_len = mean(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE), median_bill_len = median(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE), max_bill_len = max(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 Ã— 4 min_bill_len mean_bill_len median_bill_len max_bill_len 1 32.1 43.9 44.4 59.6 ``` ::: ::: ## `summarize` with missing data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarize(avg_bill_len = mean(bill_len)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species avg_bill_len 1 Adelie NA 2 Chinstrap 48.8 3 Gentoo NA ``` ::: ::: . . . ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="3"} penguins %>% group_by(species) %>% summarize(avg_bill_len = mean(bill_len, na.rm = TRUE)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species avg_bill_len 1 Adelie 38.8 2 Chinstrap 48.8 3 Gentoo 47.5 ``` ::: ::: ## `summarize` with missing data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code code-line-numbers="2"} penguins %>% filter(!is.na(bill_len)) %>% group_by(species) %>% summarize(avg_bill_len = mean(bill_len)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 Ã— 2 species avg_bill_len 1 Adelie 38.8 2 Chinstrap 48.8 3 Gentoo 47.5 ``` ::: ::: # Your turn:
`mutate`, `group_by`, `summarize` {background-gradient="linear-gradient(to bottom, #FFFFFF, #FFFFFF, #6BE1CA)"} âœ‹ if you have questions or need help ``{=html} when you are finished ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ```{=html}

``` ::: :::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
